[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] served in the British Army during '''World War I''' (or the "'''Great War'''"), most notably in the bloody [[Battle of the Somme]]. The earliest works of the [[legendarium]]—collected in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales Part Two]]''—were begun during the conflict. The extent to which the war and Tolkien's experience of it are reflected in his written work is a matter of much interest in Tolkien scholarship. ==Participants== '''[[T.C.B.S.|Barrovians]]:''' *[[J.R.R. [[Geoffrey Bache Smith]] and [[Robert Gilson]] join the army. [[Christopher Wiseman]] joins the navy instead. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] plans to finish his education.[[John Garth]], ''[[Tolkien and the Great War]]'' ===1915=== * '''[[10 June|June 10]]''' - Exams start at Oxford University. Because of the war, only Tolkien and 24 others remain in the entire University. Tolkien passes. * '''[[28 June|June 28]]''' - Tolkien applies at the Oxford recruiting office to join the army. * '''[[15 July|July 15]]''' - Tolkien becomes a second lieutenant, and is appointed to the 13th Service Battalion of the Lancashire Fusilliers. * '''[[25 September|September 25]]''' - The Big Four of the [[T.C.B.S.]] - Tolkien, Smith, Wiseman and Gilson - have their last meeting. * '''[[21 November|November 21]]''' - G.B. Smith is shipped to France. ===1916=== * '''[[2 January|January 2]]''' - Wiseman reports for duty at the [[wikipedia:HMS Superb (1907)|HMS Superb]] in [[wikipedia:Invergordon|Invergordon]]. * '''[[8 January|January 8]]''' - Robert Gilson is promoted to Lieutenant and shipped to France. * '''[[16 March|March 16]]''' - Tolkien receives his degree at the [[University of Oxford]]. * '''[[22 March|March 22]]''' - Tolkien marries [[Edith Tolkien|Edith Bratt]].[[Humphrey Carpenter]], ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: A Biography]]'' * '''[[31 May|May 31]] - [[1 June|June 1]]''' - Christopher Wiseman fights in the [[wikipedia:Battle of Jutland|Battle of Jutland]]. * '''[[2 June|June 2]]''' - Tolkien receives orders to report in Folkestone, and prepare for embarking. * '''[[4 June|June 4]]''' - Tolkien is shipped to Étaples, France. * '''[[27 June|June 27]]''' - Tolkien leaves Étaples, and goes to the Somme front. * '''[[1 July|July 1]]''' - One of the bloodiest battles in recent history, the [[Battle of the Somme]], starts. Robert Gilson is one of the first of the 360,000 British casualties when he is hit by a shell at La Boiselle. * '''[[14 July|July 14]]''' - Tolkien's C-company is sent into action at the Somme front. This is Tolkien's first 5-day front-line duty.Martin Gilbert, ''[http://www.thecuttingedgenews.com/index.php?article=716&pageid=23&pagename=Arts What Tolkien Taught Me about the Battle of the Somme]'' * '''[[22 July|July 22]]''' - [[Ralph Payton|Ralph "the Baby" Payton]], one of the T.C.B.S., is killed in the Battle of the Somme. His body is never identified. * '''[[24 July|July 24]]''' - Tolkien's second five day front-line duty begins. * '''[[19 August|August 19]]''' - Tolkien and G.B. Smith meet at Acheux. * '''[[26 October|October 26]]''' - While in reserve, Tolkien's battalion is inspected by [[wikipedia:Douglas Haig, 1st Earl Haig|Sir Doulgas Haig]], the British commander at the Battle of the Somme. * '''[[27 October|October 27]]''' – J.R.R. Tolkien is struck by trench fever, which ends his active service after just 5 months. * '''[[28 October|October 28]]''' – Tolkien is hospitalized. * '''[[8 November|November 8]]''' - Tolkien is repatriated. He now stays at a hospital in [[Birmingham]]. * '''[[18 November|November 18]]''' - The Battle of the Somme ends. Neither side wins. Tolkien is officially stricken off as a casualty by his Battalion. * '''[[29 November|November 29]]''' - G.B. Smith is hit by shrapnel, and wounded on his right arm and thigh. * '''[[3 December|December 3]]''' - G.B. Smith dies of gas-gangrene in his wounds. The news does not reach Tolkien until the 16th. * '''[[16 December|December 16]] - [[25 December|25]]''' - Tolkien recovers, and he and Edith visit [[Great Haywood]]. ===1917=== * '''[[12 January|January 12]]''' - Tolkien's leave of absence (to recover from his trench fever) ends, but he is far from recovered. * '''[[29 January|January 29]]''' - Tolkien faces a Medical Board in Birmingham, but he is not deemed fit to return to war. * '''[[February]]''' - Tolkien faces his second Medical Board, but is again deemed unfit for duty. * '''[[27 February|February 27]]''' - Tolkien faces his third Medical Board, and again his leave is extended. * '''[[18 April|April 18]]''' - Tolkien and Wiseman, the Great Twin Brethren, meet in Harrogate, and discuss the fate of the [[T.C.B.S.|Barrovians]] and the future of the Society. * '''[[19 April|April 19]]''' - Tolkien, in revalidation, is assigned to the Humber Garrison, but is not fit enough. * '''[[1 June|June 1]]''' - Tolkien is considered fit for service again, but he is not reassigned to the Lancashire Fusilliers. * '''[[29 June|June 29]]''' - J.R.R. Tolkien succumbs to gastritis while at Brocton Camp. * '''[[1 August|August 1]]''' - [[Thomas Kenneth Barnsley|"Tea Cake" Barnsley]] is killed in Ypres. * '''[[13 October|October 13]]'''- Tolkien is found unfit for duty for six months, but able to do a desk job. * '''[[November]]''' – Tolkien moves into [[50 St. John's Street]]. * '''[[16 November|November 16]]''' - The Tolkien's first son, [[John Tolkien|John]], is born. ===1918=== * '''[[11 October|October 11]]''' - Tolkien is officially released from Brooklands Hospital, Birmingham. * '''[[11 November|November 11]]''' - The War comes to an end in a cease-fire. ===1919=== * '''[[17 February|February 17]]''' - [[Hilary Tolkien]] returns home.[[Hilary Tolkien]], [[Angela Gardner]] (ed.), ''[[Black & White Ogre Country]]'', page 50 * '''[[28 June|June 28]]''' - The war officially ends, with the signing of the Treaty of Versailles. * '''[[15 July|July 15]]''' - Tolkien is released from service. * '''[[16 July|July 16]]''' - Tolkien is officially demobilized. ==Further reading== ''[[Tolkien and the Great War]]'' by [[John Garth]] ==External links== *[http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/pathways/firstworldwar/people/p_tolkien_app.htm J.R.R.
